data.title: Great for the money
data.text:
This is not a five star resort. This is however a great place to take a family at an affordable price. Each suite has two full bedrooms and two full bathrooms. They also have a complete large kitchen and full dinning room. The living room is separate and had a couch that converts to a double bed.
Thre is volleyball, ping pong, miniature golf, swimming pool and tennis courts. A little updating is in order but the accommodations are clean and comfortable. I would recommend this to anyone other than someone looking for a 5 star hotel.

data.title: Nice low key resort
data.text: We decided to stay here because we got a good deal that beat the price of any hotel in the area for our family of 5. We were very pleasantly surprised, especially since some of the reviews here were not downright positive. The apartment we stayed in was recently painted, everything was in tip top shape, the staff was friendly and helpful and the resort was very pleasant overall. Sure, it is not a top of the line resort with all the plush and luxury, but it is not pretending to be one, and for what it is (a low key resort with a single pool, hot tub, tennis court, a gym and a small activity center with a pool table and a ping pong table), this is a very nice place. The apartments are modern, clean and well appointed. We couldn't ask for a better place to spend the two nights we stayed in the area.

data.title: Visit daughter in St Augustine
data.text: Great family resort. Plenty of local quiet beaches close by. 30 minutes to St Augustine via 95. 40 minutes via beautiful hwy A1A. For more party atmosphere head south 35 minutes to Daytona. Big 2 BR 2 bath units with dining and large living area.

data.title: Paid so little for such a great place....LOVED IT!!!!
data.text: we spent 3 nights for a family of 5 the bedrooms were very spacious two bathrooms master bedroom was like living in my home. they had all utilities you need in the kitchen and plenty of towels if you needed more just call and they bring it right to you. The patio View was spectacular and refreshing. Pool was huge and very nice. Had a small club house to play pool and ping pong and mini golf which my son loved. i seen a nice bike trail but didnt get the chance to experience it. It was great distance from both Daytona and Cresent Beach abt 15-30min drive both ways. Over all i would stay again.

data.title: Not bad--not good
data.text:
The rooms was large size and clean.  The location was a little hard to locate as it was tucked in among larger buildings.  The resort had wif-fi but you had to pay a resort fee extra.  There was no maid service while we stayed.  Checked in on Thursday morning and left Sunday morning.

The resort has a 'moat' running around it with Koi fish in it.  Could have been charming in the daytime; however, in the evening and ALL night the frogs made a racket that could be heard inside the units.  It kept me up until 3:30 am before finally falling asleep to only have to get up at 6:00 am.

data.title: You get what you pay for.
data.text: I recently stayed at The Harbor Club.  I only paid $99/night, so that explains what I got.  The rooms are dated.  I stayed 3 nights and never received maid service - no beds made, no clean towels, no replenished shampoo/conditioner.  I requested a 4:30 am wake-up call for a flight I had to catch at the airport 1.5 hours away - I got the wake up call at 3:30 - an hour before the time I requested.  I couldn't wait to get home.  There is nothing in this town unless you're into golf.  The bedding is cheap and had scratchy balls on the sheets.  They also don't have wifi.  Who doesn't have wifi these days?  If you needed to use wifi - you had to go sit in the check-in area.  There was not even the option to purchase it for use in your room.  The area appears to be hit hard from the bad economy.  Very depressing area.  I don't suggest this place.  I would pay some extra $$$ to get a better = more enjoyable stay with good accommodations.

data.title: Absolutely unbelievable accomodations for the money!! Top notch!!
data.text: We spent a weekend & didn't want to leave. Peaceful, beautiful setting a few miles inland, but well worth it.Make sure you go to the European Village. Rent or bring your bikes, as there's a lovely bike trail along the water for quite a good distance. I didn't cover the whole thing, so I'm not sure how long it is. Slide up under the falls in the pool & let the water hit your neck & shoulders. Heavenly outdoor hydrotherapy. I spent a lot of time doing just that. Not a rowdy party place, which suited us just fine. Laid back, cool & serene. Got some stunning photos. I'm just not sure why this won't also come up under Celebrity Resorts, because that's the name of it.

data.title: A Home Away From Home ! !
data.text:
I traveled there with my husband and son. The suites were extremely spacious and had all the trappings of home. The unit even had it's own washer and dryer. The master bedroom and bathroom provided a large and private area, with a large hot tub and standup shower. The unit has a complete kitchen with dishwasher and a large dinning room. The screened in porch was exceptional and provided the whole family a place for hours of entertainment.
The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The pool was great fun and it took some effort to get the kids out. The activity center had some nice things for the kids. We'll surely stay again and would highly recommend it to others.........

data.title: love it
data.text: we have gone to the harbor club one week a year for the last 3or4years,we also go to other places, also travel other countries  ,but it  would not be a great vaction year without going there.the staff is great and will go the extra mile to please you.we love the quietness.after the hustle and bustle of daily life thats the place to go

data.title: We enjoyed delightful week at the Harbour Club...
data.text:
We enjoyed delightful week (June15, 2003) at the Harbour Club in Palm Coast, FL.. the units are fairly large with 2-bedrooms, 2-bathrooms, full kitchen and a large screened porch.. the resort is part of a rather large resort complex previously owned by ITT Sheraton and includes a resort hotel and a marina on the intercoastal waterway.. an outdoor pool, miniature golf, shuffle board, bicycle rental and an activity center are among the resort's amenities.. a TERRRIFIC 3-mile paved path skirts the intercoastal from the resort into the town center for strolling. biking, roller blading, etc.. 

Over the intercoastal bridge (a $2 fee going, but free on the return trip) is an area referred to by the Spanish as the 'Hammocks'.. a considerable amount of development is on-going here with a major golf club and residential home building.. here on Jungle Hut Road is a secluded, WONDERFUL beach with soft cinnamon colored sand, swooping Pelicans and frolicking Dolphins.. 

About an hour's drive north is ST. Augustine, the nation's oldest settlement.. along the way on A1A (the scenic coastal highway) is a state park and and oceanarium, both worth visiting.. 

To the south about an hour's drive is the frantic activity of Daytona Beach which includes NASCAR racing, flee markets and shopping.. not to be missed, again along A1A, is the community of Flagler Beach and many freely accessible public beach facilities where we enjoyed picnic lunches from the nearest Publix deli.. 

Joe Tragesser

data.title: Some Good Some Bad
data.text:
Rooms were nice and the grounds were well done, however, it appears that the management is saving money on Maintenance. 

The pool was beautiful but the heater never worked and it was ice cold all week. Every staff member we asked told us a different story about when it would be fixed and how long it had been broken.

One day the keys to the padlock on the hot tub gate were lost. Took a whole day to get permission to cut the $5 padlock so guests could get in.

Activities Center often was not open for use.

data.title: What a dump
data.text: Very sad when the best part of the room is the bathroom.  They charged a 6.75 per day resort fee for coffee, fax, newspaper etc.  Both days we were there we were told to go and buy a newspaper at the Marina.  We heard the place was going to be torn down after the tourist season, the rate does not reflect what you are going to get, clearly they have stopped trying.

data.title: A nice place to stay
data.text: We stayed at the Harbor Club and had an excellent visit. Rooms were spacious and clean. The resort was wonderfully secluded and quiet, especially for that part of Florida. The pool and exercise room were nice, and we especially enjoyed the tree-lined walkway along the Intercoastal Waterway. We loved the resort and the neighborhood of Palm Coast. We would definitely return to the Harbor Club.

data.title: Don't let the Bed Bugs bite, Literally!!!
data.text: We stayed in one of the villa's at the Harbor Club. The room was nice overall, but there were bed bugs in the room we stayed in the first night. The management insisted they were "just sand fleas" as if that would be no big deal, and was not very helpul in making us satisfied. (A $40.00 gift certificate to the hotel restaurant just does not suffice when we slept with bugs and were eaten up with "bed bug bites").

data.title: nos gusto el hotel
data.text:
Viajamos  en agosto del 2010 a este destino por recomendación de unos buenos amigos y realmente nos la pasamos muy bien, Harbor Club resulto un hotel cómodo y agradable para pasar unas vacaciones  tranquilas con nuestros hijos. Este destino de la Florida lo disfrutamos muchísimo ya que en  primer lugar el resort nos resulto amplio y muy cómodo, mis hijos  realmente estuvieron encantados con la playa y la alberca. Nos agrado mucho que las habitaciones fueran tan amplias y con todos los servicios ya que así  no nos preocupamos de salir tanto del desarrollo o llevar tanta ropa ya que contaba con una excelente lavadora y secadora. El destino resulto también muy tranquilo, por lo que viajar con niños pequeños aquí es realmente recomendable porque nos sentimos seguros y  lo disfrutamos muchísimo.
En nuestras salidas aprovechamos a realizar compras y también al  rentar un auto, pudimos conocer los sitios atractivos de los alrededores, nos la pasamos de maravilla. No es un hotel cinco estrellas pero cuenta con instalaciones, restaurante y un ambiente agradable para disfrutar de las vacaciones.
También  mi esposo  y yo disfrutamos del buen ambiente que hay en el sitio en las noches hay restaurante y bares muy agradables por la zona, nos toco un clima muy agradable. Para nosotros como familia nos interesa mucho que las vacaciones de nuestros hijos  sean lo más felices para todos.
En cuanto a la comida disfrutamos de los platillos de restaurante, nos gusto que también el personal siempre estuviera muy al pendiente de todo lo que necesitábamos. Este viaje también lo pudimos combinar con los parques temáticos en Orlando, por lo que tuvimos unas maravillosas y largas vacaciones en la Florida teniendo diversión para chicos y grandes!! 
En verdad lo recomendamos ampliamente
